thread.title: Big-name comedians to perform in Houston this weekend
thread.title_full: Big-name comedians to perform in Houston this weekend

author: Andrea Waguespack, Houston Chronicle
title: Big-name comedians to perform in Houston this weekend
text:
January 15 at Revention Music Center (formerly Bayou Music Center), 520 Texas St. Kathleen Madigan January 15 at Revention Music Center (formerly Bayou Music Center), 520 Texas St. Photo: -1 Image 11 of 12 While some big-name stars are heading to Houston, don't forget about the local comics who keep the Bayou City in stitches. Rudyard's Pub (2010 Waugh Drive, 713-521-0521) hosts a free open mic night every Monday at 8 p.m. If you're brave enough, sign up and show Houston what you've got. While some big-name stars are heading to Houston, don't forget about the local comics who keep the Bayou City in stitches. Rudyard's Pub (2010 Waugh Drive, 713-521-0521) hosts a free open mic night every ... more Photo: Tre' Ridings, For The Chronicle Image 12 of 12 Big-name comedians to perform in Houston this weekend 1 / 12 Back to Gallery 
Who couldn't do with a few laughs? 
It's a great weekend for comedy in Houston, as a handful of big names make their way to the stage. 
Aziz Ansari and Amy Schumer perform 6 p.m. Friday, Oct. 16 at the Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavilion in The Woodlands as part of the Oddball Comedy Festival. The show will also feature Bridget Everett, TJ Miller, Anthony Jeselnik, Jeff Ross, Nick Kroll, Nick Thune and Ashley Barnhill. 
But Friday isn't your last chance to catch great comedy. Take a look in the gallery above to see what other comedians are heading to Houston this weekend (and beyond).
